alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 1:08AM CDT until May 07 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Henry IA County in southeastern Iowa... Central Jefferson County in southeastern Iowa... * Until 715 AM CDT Sunday. * At 108 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fairfield, Wayland, Lockridge, Maharishi Vedic City, Packwood, Rome, Pleasant Plain, Salina, Beckwith, Perlee, East Pleasant Plain, Germanville, Mac Coon Access, Merrimac, Fairfield Municipal Airport, Jefferson County Park, Jefferson County Fairgrounds and Trenton. This includes the following streams and drainages... Brush Creek, Walnut Creek, Rock Creek, Sugar Creek, Williams Creek, Honey Creek, Wolf Creek, Burr Oak Creek, Crow Creek, Jones Branch, Rocky Branch, Mitchell Creek and Troy Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
